title: OpenAI's GPT Evolution
thread:
The untold story of how OpenAI went from a non-profit to a $90B company isn't what you think
---
In 2015, Elon Musk and Sam Altman founded OpenAI with a simple mission: ensure AI benefits all of humanity. But the path they took shocked everyone
---
What started as open-source research pivoted to closed models. The reason? They discovered something that changed everything about AI development
---
Here's the inside story of OpenAI's transformation and what it means for the future of AI

title: Airbnb's Near-Death Experience
thread:
In 2008, Airbnb was selling cereal boxes to survive. Today they're worth $75 billion. Here's the insane story of their darkest hour
---
Brian Chesky and his co-founders were $40,000 in debt. They maxed out credit cards and couldn't pay rent. Investors laughed them out of meetings
---
Then they did something desperate: Created Obama O's and Cap'n McCain's cereal during the 2008 election. They made $30,000 selling breakfast cereal
---
That cereal money kept them alive just long enough to get into Y Combinator. The rest is history

title: SpaceX's Impossible Dream
thread:
Everyone said landing a rocket was impossible. SpaceX failed 3 times and nearly went bankrupt. Then something incredible happened
---
December 2015: After multiple explosions, SpaceX had one last shot. Elon Musk spent his last $100M. The entire company's future rode on 9 minutes
---
When Falcon 9 touched down at Cape Canaveral, grown engineers cried. They had just changed spaceflight forever
---
That landing saved $60M per launch and made Mars colonization possible. Here's the untold story of that historic night

title: Bitcoin's Anonymous Creator
thread:
Satoshi Nakamoto owns 1 million Bitcoin worth $40 billion. They haven't touched it in 14 years. The story gets stranger
---
In 2008, a mysterious figure published the Bitcoin whitepaper. They collaborated with developers for 2 years, then vanished completely
---
Their final message: "I've moved on to other things." Since then, silence. Their Bitcoin wallet remains untouched - the ultimate diamond hands
---
Who was Satoshi? Why did they disappear? The answer might be more shocking than you think

title: CRISPR Revolution
thread:
In 2020, two scientists won the Nobel Prize for discovering how to edit human DNA. What they're doing now will blow your mind
---
Jennifer Doudna couldn't sleep after her CRISPR discovery. She realized she'd created technology that could redesign life itself
---
Now CRISPR is curing genetic diseases thought impossible to treat. Sickle cell, blindness, cancer - all being reversed at the DNA level
---
But here's what's really wild: We're just getting started. The next 5 years of gene editing will transform humanity

title: MrBeast's Formula
thread:
MrBeast turned down $1 billion for his YouTube channel. When you see his business model, you'll understand why
---
Jimmy started making videos at 13 in his mom's basement. He studied YouTube for 10 hours a day, obsessing over what makes videos go viral
---
His secret? He spends $3M per video and gives it all away. Last year: $54M revenue. His channels are worth more than most TV networks
---
But the real genius is what he's building next. Hint: It's not about YouTube anymore

title: Tesla's Master Plan
thread:
In 2006, Elon Musk published Tesla's "Secret Master Plan" on a blog. Everyone laughed. Today, it reads like prophecy
---
Step 1: Build sports car
Step 2: Use that money to build affordable car
Step 3: Use that money to build even more affordable car
Step 4: Provide solar power
---
17 years later, Tesla is worth more than the next 10 automakers combined. But here's what everyone missed about the plan
---
It was never about cars. The real goal was something much bigger

title: Epic vs Apple Battle
thread:
Epic Games declared war on Apple and Google on the same day. They knew they'd lose billions. Here's why they did it anyway
---
August 2020: Epic secretly updated Fortnite with direct payments, breaking App Store rules. They had lawyers on standby and a campaign ready
---
Within hours, Fortnite was banned. Epic released a "1984" parody video. The gaming world went insane. It was all planned
---
Tim Sweeney wasn't fighting for Fortnite. He was fighting for the metaverse. And he might have won

title: Impossible Foods Story
thread:
A Stanford professor spent 5 years studying why meat tastes like meat. His discovery is now worth $7 billion
---
Pat Brown found the secret: heme, an iron molecule in blood. He figured out how to make it from plants. Burger King was interested
---
The first taste test was a disaster. The second was worse. But the 3rd version fooled professional chefs. Even hardcore meat lovers couldn't tell
---
Now Impossible is in 40,000 restaurants. But burgers were just the beginning. Wait until you see what's next

title: Khan Academy's AI Tutor
thread:
Khan Academy just launched an AI tutor that might replace traditional education. What it can do is absolutely mind-blowing
---
Sal Khan started by tutoring his cousin over Yahoo Messenger. Now his AI can tutor 100 million students simultaneously in any subject
---
The AI doesn't just give answers - it asks Socratic questions, adapts to learning styles, and never loses patience. Teachers are stunned
---
GPT-4 integration means every student now has a personal tutor 24/7. The implications for global education are staggering
